image.altText: Montrezl Harrell dribbling the basketball down the court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly racially abused NBL star Montrezl Harrell via social media has been charged following what authorities have described as the "first-ever successful arrest" for such an offence in Australian basketball.

title.children: Man arrested over alleged racial abuse of NBL star Montrezl Harrell

image.altText: The logo of SA Police on the glass window of a police station.

props.synopsis: Police make an arrest over the stabbing of a man in Adelaide's inner south early on Saturday morning, and say the suspect and the victim are unknown to one another.

title.children: Man charged over stabbing in Adelaide suburb of Eastwood

image.altText: Damage to a causeway along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: While wild weather has caused damage to coastal areas, the rain has brought some relief to farmers — but they say far more will be needed to break the drought.

title.children: Storm damages historic causeway but farmers still await 'miraculous recovery'

image.altText: A sign for the Youth Court in Adelaide

props.synopsis: A teenager involved in the ambush of men lured into fake sexual encounters via social media — including threats over a degrading video — has avoided convictions for his "vigilante" crimes.

title.children: Teen sentenced for role in 'vigilante' ambush attacks on men

image.altText: A woman speaks at a dais in front of a corrugated iron wall inside a buildikng

props.synopsis: Danni Smith has appeared in court charged with assaulting a current or former partner. She says she will fight the charges and they have nothing to do with the Voice.

title.children: SA Voice to Parliament joint leader on domestic violence charges

image.altText: Firefighters and police standing on a beach in front of rocks, holding a green plastic sheet

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has died after he was found floating in waters off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south on Thursday, police say.

title.children: Man, 29, drowns off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: Businesses and pastoral stations in the Channel Country region of far-north-east South Australia could be stranded for up to eight months, after Cooper Creek's only barge was taken away for servicing two years ago.

title.children: Residents still cut off by floodwater angry over lack of planning

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in a cap wearing a black shirt with thick metal necklaces smiling in a gym.

props.synopsis: The ATO is taking legal action against founder of popular gym chain Derrimut 24:7 Nikolaos Solomos, over an alleged multi-million-dollar tax debt.

title.children: Gym chain owner once shot at by rivals facing $11 million tax bill

image.altText: A woman signing Auslan in front of a colourful flag with a lit up stage in the distance

props.synopsis: While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts.

title.children: It can take hours to prepare for one show but it's a 'joyous' task, says Auslan interpreter

image.altText: a large sandstone building with archways on a university campus

props.synopsis: Jillian Segal’s plan to combat antisemitism recommends giving herself a role in vetoing funding to universities and their researchers.

title.children: Why the government is unlikely to follow Trump's university funding cuts

image.altText: A large blaze burning on the top storey of a tall apartment complex.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has received "all necessary political signals" from the US that American military aid will be resumed.

title.children: Russia pummels Kyiv, allies pledge 'coalition of the willing' HQ in Paris

image.altText: Kevin Rudd stands at a podium and speaks in front of Australian, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island flags.

props.synopsis: New details about a meeting between Australia's ambassador to the US, Kevin Rudd, and President Donald Trump have been revealed. Follow live.

title.children: New details about Rudd's meeting with Trump revealed

image.altText: Two cars parked outside a building with sign 'Little Shining Stars Early Learning Centre', a parent walks out of glass doors

props.synopsis: Parents at an Adelaide early learning centre under investigation have shared mixed views, as data reveals a number of centres have failed to comply with national laws since June.

title.children: Parents of Klemzig early learning centre speak out amid investigation

image.altText: A light-tanned woman with light brown hair, wearing a black and gray pattern top, with purple light behind her head

props.synopsis: Following the release of coronial findings into the police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker, the head of Australia's national Aboriginal legal service says the NT is "winning the race to the bottom" with its youth justice reforms.

title.children: NT 'is winning the race to the bottom' as Australia cracks down on youth crime

image.altText: A crew member wearing a life jacket and holding a floatation device.

props.synopsis: Rescuers pull three more crew members and a security guard alive from the Red Sea a day after Iran-backed Houthi rebels sank a Greek-operated cargo ship.

title.children: Four survivors of Houthi-struck ship rescued after spending 48 hours in Red Sea

image.altText: Dr Suhana Mohd has her back facing the camera. She is wearing a flower printed hijab and is facing her work computer.

props.synopsis: A major study reveals concerning levels of Islamophobia and discrimination experienced by Muslim healthcare professionals in Australia. Experts are calling it a hidden crisis.

title.children: Doctors face Islamophobia in Australian healthcare 'crisis'

image.altText: moody image of 50- and 100-dollar notes laid out over bank statements

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are expected to rise on Friday too. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar hits highest price since November

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pentagon's investment in US rare earths firm sparks Australian rally
Stock futures down, US dollar up on tariff developments
Breaking: Aussie dollar reverses on Trump's Canada tariff

image.altText: Protestors hold up signs which read "Survivors deserve better".

props.synopsis: Allowing sexual assault survivors to pre-record their testimony ahead of trial may mitigate the negative health impacts many experience as a result of the court process, experts say.

title.children: Sexual assault survivors call for change to 'traumatising' court process

image.altText: A police officer walks away from a grey hatchback vehicle at the scene of a crash.

props.synopsis: Police are yet to interview an elderly driver over a crash that killed a woman and injured two other people, including a toddler, in Melbourne's east.

title.children: Police yet to interview 91yo driver after woman killed in car crash

image.altText: Rinky Hijikata and David Pel embrace as they pose for a photograph.

props.synopsis: Australia's Rinky Hijikata and Dutch partner David Pel, who were barely familiar with each other before Wimbledon, advance to the men's doubles final.

title.children: 'Ice in my veins': Aussie Hijikata roars into Wimbledon doubles final

image.altText: The original Birkin bag on top of black glass display case.

props.synopsis: The bag was created for the late actress Jane Birkin.

title.children: Fashion brand Hermès's original Birkin bag sells for $15.2 million at auction

image.altText: Man with white beard, black-rimmed glasses and grey hoodie

props.synopsis: A nursing student desperate to prove he did not use prohibited artificial intelligence software to complete a workbook says his reputation is on the line, but Murdoch University is holding firm.

title.children: Uni student accused of using AI in assignment fights to clear his name

image.altText: Jay Higgins sitting in a loader bucket holding his baby

props.synopsis: A young West Australian father's organs have been donated after a tragic farming accident left him with a severe brain injury.

title.children: Farming family's heartbreaking decision after freak accident

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has nominated "affordable child care" as the legacy he wants to leave. It's all the more surprising, then, that the government didn't seem to spot a plethora of problems in an area so central to the prime minister's ambitions.

title.children: Child care is the canary in the coalmine for wider policy delivery problems

image.altText: An elderly woman wearing black rimmed glasses, a headscarf, a beige coat and a pearl necklace.

props.synopsis: Former Bangladesh prime minister Sheikh Hasina is indicted over the deaths of hundreds of people during student-led protests last year.

title.children: Ousted Bangladesh PM indicted on charges of crimes against humanity

image.altText: x-ray

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Time to find out!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new US political party, Piastri penalised and a cat's shock X-ray

image.altText: man stands on stage addressing crowd

props.synopsis: Shocking allegations have been made against the Queensland branch of the union this week. But it is no stranger to controversy.

title.children: What came before the damning report into the Queensland CFMEU

image.altText: A man in a floral shirt lies in a hospital bed with an oxygen tube nestled on his large grey handlebar moustache.

props.synopsis: Former Rugby League front rower Sam Backo is in intensive care after contracting melioidosis, which has killed 34 Queenslanders so far this year.

title.children: Rugby league great Sam Backo battles deadly disease as cases surge

image.altText: A woman holds her phone in front of her while standing in front of a large TikTok sign on a wall

props.synopsis: The latest move by the European regulator follows an investigation that resulted in the company receiving a massive fine for transferring data to China.

title.children: TikTok being investigated for storing user data in China

image.altText: Ruth, who has Down Syndrome, looking at the camera smiling wearing a shirt with flowers on it and glasses with tied brown hair

props.synopsis: Ruth Faragher, who lives with Down syndrome, says support workers need to know when to step in and when to let a person do things themselves.

title.children: Research into safety becoming restrictive for adults with intellectual disability

image.altText: A red kelpie sits on top of a paddle board with his handler.

props.synopsis: Victorian scientists enlist sniffer dogs on paddle boards to locate platypuses in the wild and increase knowledge of the iconic species without damaging their habitat.

title.children: Paddle pups on board with mission to protect iconic platypus

image.altText: A woman wearing an Indigenous red patterned shirt holds her baby upclose, with just the baby's feet showing.

props.synopsis: After an upbringing of trauma, addiction and being in and out of custody, a new program is providing parolees like Sarah with hope — helping get her youngest baby back in her care.

title.children: 'I've had a very hard journey': The program giving people like Sarah hope

image.altText: A close up of a small green aquatic plant.

props.synopsis: Aggressive and invasive, Amazon frogbit is being sold in online stores right across Australia, and has been found in the Northern Territory for the first time.

title.children: One of the 'world's worst weeds' found in Darwin fishpond

image.altText: Black text hides information in a document

props.synopsis: It took a right to information 'mistake' for the ABC to become aware of concerns about youth in adult prison watch houses. But so much more information remains buried under black ink. Does it have to be this way?

title.children: Accidental release of information a 'good thing', premier says. Should it be the norm?

image.altText: Smoke from wood fuelled heater

props.synopsis: As tourists are urged to come to Tasmania "for air", pollution in Launceston is forcing some locals to leave. Experts say if wood heaters are used properly, it could help improve air quality.

title.children: 'Unliveable': Local leaves Tasmanian city amid widespread wood heater use
